intro: Pfaffia holosericea, commonly known as sacred lotus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant is often found in wetland habitats, thriving in moist, tropical environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom during the rainy season. Pfaffia holosericea is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local cultures.
